title: Red, White & Royal Blue
author: Casey McQuiston
authorDescription: Casey McQuiston is a New York Times bestselling author known for writing contemporary romance with LGBTQ+ protagonists.
description: A romantic comedy about the First Son of the United States falling for the Prince of Wales.

title: The Song of Achilles
author: Madeline Miller
authorDescription: Madeline Miller is a classical scholar and author who reimagines Greek mythology with emotional depth.
description: A retelling of the Iliad focusing on the relationship between Achilles and Patroclus.

title: She Drives Me Crazy
author: Kelly Quindlen
authorDescription: Kelly Quindlen writes YA contemporary fiction featuring queer girls and authentic relationships.
description: A sports-themed lesbian romance between two high school rivals.

title: Cemetery Boys
author: Aiden Thomas
authorDescription: Aiden Thomas is a trans author writing Own Voices stories about trans and Latinx characters.
description: A trans boy summons a ghost and accidentally falls in love in this Latinx urban fantasy.

title: One Last Stop
author: Casey McQuiston
authorDescription: Casey McQuiston is a New York Times bestselling author known for writing contemporary romance with LGBTQ+ protagonists.
description: A bisexual woman falls for a time-displaced punk girl on the subway.

title: The Priory of the Orange Tree
author: Samantha Shannon
authorDescription: Samantha Shannon is an author of epic fantasy novels with diverse characters and complex world-building.
description: An epic standalone fantasy featuring a romance between a queen and her protector.

title: Felix Ever After
author: Kacen Callender
authorDescription: Kacen Callender is a bestselling author and National Book Award winner writing diverse, Own Voices stories.
description: A trans teen navigates identity, love, and art in contemporary New York.

title: Gideon the Ninth
author: Tamsyn Muir
authorDescription: Tamsyn Muir writes genre-bending science fantasy with dark humor and complex characters.
description: Lesbian necromancers in space solve a locked-room murder mystery.

title: They Both Die at the End
author: Adam Silvera
authorDescription: Adam Silvera is a New York Times bestselling author known for emotional contemporary YA with diverse characters.
description: Two boys meet on their last day alive and embark on one final adventure together.

title: The House in the Cerulean Sea
author: TJ Klune
authorDescription: TJ Klune is a Lambda Award-winning author known for heartwarming fantasy featuring LGBTQ+ characters.
description: A caseworker investigates an orphanage of magical children and finds unexpected love.

title: Heartstopper Volume 1
author: Alice Oseman
authorDescription: Alice Oseman is a British author and illustrator known for wholesome LGBTQ+ stories.
description: A gentle love story between two British schoolboys told in graphic novel format.

title: Aristotle and Dante Discover the Secrets of the Universe
author: Benjamin Alire Sáenz
authorDescription: Benjamin Alire Sáenz is a poet and author writing lyrical coming-of-age stories about Mexican American teens.
description: Two Mexican American boys form a deep friendship that becomes something more.

title: The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo
author: Taylor Jenkins Reid
authorDescription: Taylor Jenkins Reid writes character-driven historical fiction exploring fame, love, and identity.
description: A reclusive Hollywood icon reveals her scandalous life story and hidden love affair.

title: Pet
author: Akwaeke Emezi
authorDescription: Akwaeke Emezi is a nonbinary Nigerian author writing genre-bending stories about identity and transformation.
description: A trans girl in a utopian world must confront hidden monsters.

title: Simon vs. the Homo Sapiens Agenda
author: Becky Albertalli
authorDescription: Becky Albertalli writes contemporary YA romance featuring LGBTQ+ teens in authentic, heartwarming stories.
description: A closeted teen's emails with an anonymous classmate are discovered, leading to blackmail.

title: Boyfriend Material
author: Alexis Hall
authorDescription: Alexis Hall writes witty contemporary romance with complex LGBTQ+ characters.
description: A messy rock star's son needs a fake boyfriend to clean up his image.

title: Circe
author: Madeline Miller
authorDescription: Madeline Miller is a classical scholar and author who reimagines Greek mythology with emotional depth.
description: The story of the witch Circe, featuring a subtle romance with Athena.

title: The Gentleman's Guide to Vice and Virtue
author: Mackenzi Lee
authorDescription: Mackenzi Lee writes historical YA adventures with diverse, complex characters.
description: A bisexual lord and his best friend embark on a Grand Tour adventure in the 1700s.

title: This Is How You Lose the Time War
author: Amal El-Mohtar & Max Gladstone
authorDescription: Amal El-Mohtar and Max Gladstone are award-winning authors of lyrical speculative fiction.
description: Two time-traveling agents from opposing sides fall in love through letters across time.

title: I Wish You All the Best
author: Mason Deaver
authorDescription: Mason Deaver is a nonbinary author writing Own Voices stories about acceptance and mental health.
description: A nonbinary teen is kicked out by their parents and finds support from their estranged sister.

title: Carry On
author: Rainbow Rowell
authorDescription: Rainbow Rowell writes contemporary fiction and fantasy with authentic characters and relationships.
description: A chosen one wizard and his vampire roommate navigate magic school and their feelings.

title: The Darkness Outside Us
author: Eliot Schrefer
authorDescription: Eliot Schrefer is a two-time National Book Award finalist writing diverse science fiction and fantasy.
description: Two astronauts on a mission to save their sisters discover shocking truths about their reality.

title: We Are Okay
author: Nina LaCour
authorDescription: Nina LaCour is a Printz Award-winning author known for lyrical, emotional contemporary fiction.
description: A girl isolates herself after her grandfather's death until her best friend visits.

title: The魔道祖师 (Grandmaster of Demonic Cultivation)
author: Mo Xiang Tong Xiu
authorDescription: Mo Xiang Tong Xiu is a Chinese web novelist known for danmei (boys' love) fantasy epics.
description: A resurrected cultivator reunites with his soulmate to solve supernatural mysteries.

title: Last Night at the Telegraph Club
author: Malinda Lo
authorDescription: Malinda Lo is a Chinese American author writing LGBTQ+ YA fiction and nonfiction.
description: A Chinese American girl discovers a lesbian nightclub in 1950s San Francisco.

title: A Little Life
author: Hanya Yanagihara
authorDescription: Hanya Yanagihara writes intense, literary fiction exploring trauma, friendship, and love.
description: Four college friends navigate life, success, and trauma in New York City.

title: If This Gets Out
author: Sophie Gonzales & Cale Dietrich
authorDescription: Sophie Gonzales and Cale Dietrich are YA authors who collaborated on this boy band romance.
description: Two members of a world-famous boy band secretly fall in love.

title: The Charm Offensive
author: Alison Cochrun
authorDescription: Alison Cochrun writes contemporary romance featuring neurodivergent and LGBTQ+ characters.
description: A producer falls for the contestant on a reality dating show.

title: Loveless
author: Alice Oseman
authorDescription: Alice Oseman is a British author and illustrator known for wholesome LGBTQ+ stories.
description: A girl discovers her asexual and aromantic identity while starting university.

title: The Witch King
author: H.E. Edgmon
authorDescription: H.E. Edgmon is a transmasculine author writing Own Voices fantasy with trans protagonists.
description: A trans witch prince must reclaim his throne while navigating fae politics.

title: Stone Butch Blues
author: Leslie Feinberg
authorDescription: Leslie Feinberg was a pioneering transgender activist and author exploring gender identity.
description: A coming-of-age story of a butch lesbian navigating identity in pre-Stonewall America.

title: The Miseducation of Cameron Post
author: Emily M. Danforth
authorDescription: Emily M. Danforth writes authentic coming-of-age stories about queer rural America.
description: A Montana girl is sent to conversion therapy after being discovered with another girl.

title: More Happy Than Not
author: Adam Silvera
authorDescription: Adam Silvera is a New York Times bestselling author known for emotional contemporary YA with diverse characters.
description: A teen considers a memory-alteration procedure to forget he's gay in a futuristic Bronx.

title: Ash
author: Malinda Lo
authorDescription: Malinda Lo is a Chinese American author writing LGBTQ+ YA fiction and nonfiction.
description: A lesbian retelling of Cinderella where she falls for the huntress instead of the prince.

title: I'll Give You the Sun
author: Jandy Nelson
authorDescription: Jandy Nelson is a Printz Award-winning author known for lyrical, artistic contemporary fiction.
description: Twin siblings tell their story of art, love, and family from different points in time.

author: Ben Macintyre
authorDescription: Ben Macintyre is a historian and author specializing in espionage and Cold War history.

title: Dreadnought
author: April Daniels
authorDescription: April Daniels is a trans author writing superhero fiction with trans protagonists.
description: A trans girl inherits superpowers that transform her body to match her identity.

author: Jen Ferguson
authorDescription: Jen Ferguson is a Métis/Anishinaabe author writing Own Voices stories about Indigenous teens.

title: In the Dream House
author: Carmen Maria Machado
authorDescription: Carmen Maria Machado is an award-winning author known for experimental, genre-bending memoirs and fiction.

title: Heaven Official's Blessing
author: Mo Xiang Tong Xiu
authorDescription: Mo Xiang Tong Xiu is a Chinese web novelist known for danmei (boys' love) fantasy epics.
description: A god falls from heaven and joins forces with a mysterious ghost in this epic romance.

title: The Feeling of Falling in Love
author: Mason Deaver
authorDescription: Mason Deaver is a nonbinary author writing Own Voices stories about acceptance and mental health.
description: A teen asks his friend to fake date him to get his ex back, but real feelings develop.

title: On Earth We're Briefly Gorgeous
author: Ocean Vuong
authorDescription: Ocean Vuong is a poet and novelist exploring identity, masculinity, and the immigrant experience.

title: The Perks of Being a Wallflower
author: Stephen Chbosky
authorDescription: Stephen Chbosky writes coming-of-age stories exploring adolescence, mental health, and identity.
description: An introverted freshman navigates high school with the help of misfit friends.

author: Alison Bechdel
authorDescription: Alison Bechdel is a cartoonist and memoirist known for the Bechdel Test and autobiographical comics.

authorDescription: Arkady Martine is a Hugo Award-winning author of space opera with complex political intrigue.

description: Three people navigate an unconventional family arrangement after an unexpected pregnancy.

authorDescription: Rivers Solomon is a nonbinary author writing Afrofuturist fiction exploring identity and memory.
description: An underwater civilization descended from pregnant African slaves explores ancestral trauma.

description: A showrunner and her assistant fake a relationship that becomes real.

authorDescription: André Aciman writes literary fiction exploring desire, memory, and identity.
description: A seventeen-year-old falls for his father's research assistant during an Italian summer.

title: When the Moon Was Ours
